question: What is the name of this Traditional Dress?
aboutAnswer:
Flamenco is the dress traditionally worn by women at Ferias (festivals) in Andalusia, Spain.
Traditionally, the outfit is completed with a shawl (mant√≥n de Manila) worn over the shoulders. The traditional dancer will also wear her hair in a bun adorned with flowers, and perhaps a decorative hair comb.
The outfit originated in the late 19th and early 20th centuries when women vendors dressed in modest calico gowns trimmed with ruffles came to the fairs along with livestock traders.
